entry.title: SOAP API for inbound delivery updates
entry.content:
Hey, experts!

We have the requirement to create batch split items for an inbound delivery. I found this post that references a SOAP API:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/adding-quot-create-batch-split-quot-to-api-inbound-delivery-srv-0002/qaq-p/12454560

However this reading through the documentation, it is not evident how to create a batch split item for an already existing delivery. What payload needs to be passed? The API returns no response whatsoever and it's difficult to deduce what is needed. Is there some example / technical docu / for calling this API https://api.sap.com/api/WAREHOUSESTOCKTRANSFERRECEIPTA/overview ?

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: Global Feature Contron in RAP, Feature control in RAP
entry.content:
Nice overview about the global feature handling.

There is one usecase where i would like to know if you have a solution for it.

I have a static factory action to control the creation of data for my RAP BO. So in the BDEF it looks like this:

static factory action ( features : global ) s_factory_create_by_ref
parameter ZS_REF_PARAM[1];

And in the Projection like this:

  use action s_factory_create_by_ref;

And i also have an implementation for the FEATURES GLOBAL in my behavior implementation class:

  METHOD m_get_global_features.
    CHECK requested_features IS NOT INITIAL.
    result-%action-s_factory_create_by_ref = if_abap_behv=>fc-o-disabled.
  ENDMETHOD.

My expectation would be, that this is triggert directly before i load any data in my app, but somehow it never gets triggered.

entry.title: Re: Change sales order item to individual stock after mai...
entry.content:
My request is when you create a discussion like this, please also add what the Business requirement is and why you want to change the item category. This will help to assist and show the right direction.

Now coming to your requirement, it sounds like you're trying to ensure that sales order items with a specific delivery priority are managed using sales order individual stock may be with special stock E.

Technically, your idea of changing the item category based on delivery priority is feasible, but before recommending a user exit, it’s important to understand the business rationale behind this. For example:

  • Is this about ensuring dedicated stock for high-priority customers?
  • Is it to prevent stock from being consumed by other orders?
  • Is it tied to a specific fulfillment or service-level agreement?

Once the business goal is clear, we can explore whether item category substitution is the right path — and if so, which enhancement point, or user exit best supports it.

entry.title: Re: SAP Public cloud and Warehouse bin migration object
entry.content:
Hello ST24,

first of all, the answer that you have accepted before is only partially correct.

The Warehouse - Storage bin object is supporting creation of new Bins. I have successfully tested it a few minutes ago in a Public Cloud system. It is not foreseen to update Bins, as the documentation is correctly saying.

The enhanced description (tooltip) is indeed misleading as it was initially build for WM storage bins to be used in objects such as Product, Production Version, Product - Extend. Unfortunately it was also  being reused for the Warehouse - storage bin object.  I have just created a task to get this fixed with the next Publio Cloud CFD release (probably 2508.2). The misleading sentence will be removed. Regarding your error message that you are getting when you try to migrate Warehouse - storage bins, can you please provide the full error message text, the error message ID/class and the error message number. It is then easier to see where you problem comes from. Probably there is either an issue with the configuration or an issue with the data in the template. You can still create a ticket here. But it is definitely possible to create Warehouse storage bins with the migration object.

BR

Frank

entry.title: Re: Table maintenance alternatives in S/4HANA on premise
entry.content:
I was very successful using Maintenance Objects to replace SM30-based transactions. I would not recommend Custom Business Objects because always those UI tools lack functionality that is often needed.

The only drawback I see today on both is those used for customizing activity. There is no out of the box solution to make apps created using those request a customizing transport to move the data to other environments.

Still, I have found some posts here in the SAP Community that people have enhanced their RAP BO by using actions or similar concepts to be able to achieve this with some custom code on the behavior pool class.

It's also possible to create tiles pointing to the Custom Business Configurations app by passing a parameter for a given Maintenance Object. The documentation is not so clear and I was only successful doing that by using the same semantic object + action from the standard app. (#BusinessConfiguration-maintain)

entry.title: Re: How to do budgets for purchase in sap s4 hana public...
entry.content:
Even without SAC, SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud offers Public Sector Management (PSM) capabilities that allow you to:

1. Define Budget Using Budget Documents
Use the Manage Budget Documents app to manually enter budget amounts. Assign budgets to cost centers, projects (WBS), or funds depending on your setup.

2. Enable Budget Availability Control
This is the key feature that checks whether a PR or PO exceeds the available budget. It works for expense-type G/L accounts — and not directly for inventory (balance sheet) accounts. For inventory materials, budget control kicks in at the point of consumption, not at the time of procurement. So the budget validation happens when the material is issued to a cost center or project — not when it's received into stock.

3. PR Budget Validation Setup
To enable budget validation for PRs:

  • ensure the account assignment category is set to K (Cost Center), P (Project), or A (Asset) — not blank.
  • Maintain PSM account assignments in the PR line item.
  • Activate availability control in the budget configuration for the relevant fund center or cost object.

entry.title: Re: confidential enterprise projects
entry.content:
Hi @tomlovelock 

Your observation is correct, in Enterprise Projects within SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, there are dedicated fields for controlling visibility and confidentiality, namely Authorisation Group and Confidential Project. These are the recommended mechanisms to restrict access, rather than cost centres.

  1. Authorisation Group
  • The field Authorisation Group in I_EnterpriseProject can be used to classify projects and link them to specific authorisation objects.
  • This enables you to restrict project-related transactions for example financial postings, project planning and billing so that only users with the matching authorisation group in their business role can access them.
  1. Confidential Project Flag
  • The Confidential Project indicator is used for additional visibility control.
  • When marked confidential, access to the project and its related data for example WBS elements, costs, revenues and billing items is further restricted to explicitly assigned project members or authorised business roles.
  1. How to Implement in Public Cloud
  1. Maintain Authorisation Groups
    • Use the Fiori app Manage Your Solution (SSCUI) or the Maintain Authorisation Groups app if it is available in your scope.
    • Assign the groups to projects in the Enterprise Project apps.
  2. Assign to Business Roles
    • In the Maintain Business Roles app, restrict access to Enterprise Project data using the authorisation group field. Example: Role Project Controller, Defence → only sees projects with Authorisation Group = DEF.
  3. Confidential Projects
    • When the confidential flag is active, access is limited further.
    • In practice, you assign project members to the confidential project team and only those users and administrators can access the project.

Enterprise Projects (Authorisation and Confidential Projects)

Business Role and Authorisation Concept in S/4HANA Cloud

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Change sales order item to individual stock after mai...
entry.content:
To achieve this, SAP needs to treat the sales order item as requiring individual stock, which is managed under special stock indicator 'E'. This ensures that:

  • Stock is reserved specifically for that sales order
  • MRP and ATP treat it as isolated from unrestricted stock
  • Other orders cannot consume it

In item category configuration let us assume, ZTAE, set "E" against Special Stock indicator.

Next, use USEREXIT_ITEM_CAT_DETERMINATION in program MV45AFZZ to:

  • Read the delivery priority from the sales order item
  • If it matches your high-priority value (e.g., 'H'), substitute the item category to one configured for individual stock. Example: replace TAN with a custom item category ZTAE that supports special stock E.

In OVZG, map the requirement type to a planning strategy that supports special stock. This ensures proper behavior during MRP and availability check.

In my earlier post, I left few more questions which are also critical to address this requirement. They are

  • Should this apply to all customers or only specific ones?
  • Is this needed for all materials or only certain product groups?
  • Is delivery priority maintained at order entry or later?
  • Should the substitution happen only during creation or also during changes?

So for whatever reasons, you need to apply the logic accordingly based on the above queries and you can try with the exit I suggested above

entry.title: The evolution of member ordering in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction

This short blog post explains the old “Edit Member Order” for the Classic Table in the Optimized Design Experience (ODE), how it evolved into "Custom Order" with the New Table Build Experience in ODE proposed in the QRC3 2025, and what happens when you migrate Tables.

Ordering affects readability, storytelling, and how business users consume KPIs. Small UX changes here have big impact, so this is worth a quick, clear look.

 

“Edit Member Order” for [Measures] (in Optimized Design Experience – ODE)

In Classic Table (ODE), “Edit Member Order” is the manual-ordering capability used primarily for [Measures] (including calculated measures). It lets authors control the sequence of measure’s members at the same level so tables present KPIs in the exact order the business expects.

Default sorts (alphabetical, model order, or value-driven) don’t always match a narrative. Manual ordering lets you put priority metrics first, arrange measures in a business-friendly sequence, or mirror a report layout stakeholders expect.

To use it, the workflow is as follows:

  1. Open the story and switch to “Edit”;
  2. Select the table widget and open the “Builder Panel”;
  3. Locate the [Measures] you want to reorder in the Builder Panel. Click the “three-dot menu” on the measure dimension;
  4. Choose “Edit Member Order…”;
  5. In the Edit Member Order dialog, drag measures to the desired order. “Done” to apply.

 

“Custom Order” for [Measures] (ODE with New Table Build Experience)

The new approach. When switching to the New Table Build Experience (ODE), the manual ordering for [Measures] was redesigned.

The ordering control for dimension members now lives on the header region and is called “Custom Order”. This is separate from the Classic measure-centric “Edit Member Order” and is the natural, header-level experience for arranging rows or columns that come from a dimension. And It puts dimension ordering next to other column header-level actions:

  • Improve discoverability for row/column member ordering.
  • Consolidate table configuration for a clearer, more predictable authoring workflow.

To use it on [Measures], the workflow is now as follows:

  1. Open the story in Optimized Design Experience (ODE) and switch to “Edit”;
  2. Make sure you have activated the option “Switch All Tables To New Table Build Experience”;
  3. In the table widget, right-click the Measure header you want to reorder;
  4. Choose “Sort options” >> “Add Custom Order…” from the menu;
  5. In the “Create Custom Order” dialog, drag members into the desired sequence or use the movement controls. Create/save to update the table.

 

Migration behavior

Functionally, ordering controls were modernized and surfaced where they make the most sense in the New Table Build Experience.

When you migrate Classic Table to the New Table Build Experience in ODE:

  1. The “Edit Member Order option” is no longer available;
  2. Any previously defined Member Order on Measure is preserved and displayed as the default;
  3. If you want to change the default order, you can create one or multiple Custom Orders.

 

Demo

 

Conclusion

We modernized ordering so it’s more discoverable and aligned to the object type: measures order remain managed via the Builder Panel pattern in Classic Table, while all dimension members, including Measures in the New Table Build Experience are reordered from the table column’s header “Sort options >> Custom Order…”. And Converting Classic Table preserves your predefined orders as the default order.

 

Let us know what you think

We want this transition to be smooth and useful. Do not hesitate to share your feedbacks, it directly influences documentations and product improvements. Tell us:

  • Did your measure orders migrate as expected?
  • Any cases where dimension ordering behaved unexpectedly in the New Table Build Experience?

entry.title: Re: Procurement of Health Insurance premium for employees...
entry.content:
Hi @Sabarinathan_En 

Hope this is still relevant.

Your scenario can be effectively covered in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition using rate-based service procurement with contracts and service entry sheets.

  1. Here is the recommended Procurement Approach
  • Model health insurance premiums as service master records, separated by age brackets e.g. Insurance Premium 20–30 years, 31–40 years, etc.
  • Use a service purchase contract and outline agreement with validity period and condition records for each age bracket.
  • Handle pro rata charges using service entry sheets against the contract.
  1. Here is the Process Flow
  1. Service Master Setup
    • Create service masters for each relevant age bracket in the app Manage Service Master.
    • Assign a clear description e.g. “Health Insurance Premium with Age ranges between 31–40”.
  2. Contract Creation
    • Create a purchase contract using the app Manage Purchase Contracts F2144.
    • Enter service items for each age bracket with their respective rates.
    • Define validity to cover the agreement year.
  3. New Employee Addition
    • When a new employee joins, record a service entry sheet (SES) from the inclusion month until the end of the contract validity.
    • Pro rata calculation is achieved by posting only for the remaining period.
  4. Employee Exit
    • Stop further SES postings from the month after the employee leaves.
    • Since charges are SES-driven, only the covered period is billed.
  5. Dynamic Rate Determination
    • Rates vary by age bracket, handled through separate service master and contract conditions.
    • If you want the system to auto-determine the correct age bracket, you can use a Cloud BAdI for pricing e.g. MM_PUR_S4_PRICING to map employee age to the appropriate service item.
  1. Configuration Elements in Public Cloud
  • Activate scope item 18J, Service Procurement with Service Entry Sheet.
  • Maintain service master records per age bracket.
  • Configure contracts with rate conditions.
  • Optionally, you can make use of developer extensibility with a BAdI to automate the assignment of the correct rate.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

See the following references for more details:

Service Procurement with Service Entry Sheet (18J)

Manage Purchase Contracts (F2144)

Service Master Data in S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: Re: Procurement of Health Insurance premium for employees in S/4 HANA Public cloud
entry.content: That’s a really interesting use case, thanks for laying it out so clearly. Health insurance based on pro-rata and age brackets can get tricky in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud because it’s not a fixed premium model. From what I’ve seen in similar projects, the most suitable way forward is usually to treat it under the Procurement of Services process and leverage the Service PO with item category D. This allows you to work with dynamic rates and periods instead of fixed quantities. For the age-based calculation, a lot of companies either: Maintain the rate brackets in a custom price condition table so that the correct value can be pulled in automatically, or Use an integration with SuccessFactors Employee Central (if you have it) where the employee age and dependents data flows into the calculation logic. For pro-rata charges, the validity period functionality in PO/Contracts works well — you can define start and end dates and only charge for that duration. In case of early exits, you’d just adjust the service entry sheet to reflect the actual covered period.

entry.title: Stack Ranker empty for managers
entry.content:
Dear Experts, 

 we are experiencing an issue with the Stack Ranker. If a manager log in into the system and access to the Stack Ranker he/she can see the page empty.

Apparenty, we found the reason why the manager can not see the Stack Ranker data: 

The Performance forms have been launched in English US.  If the user access to the system in the same language used for the launching of the form the Stack Ranker page is filled in as expected.

We performed several tests launching the Performane forms in different languages and the tool behavior is always the same: to see data it is needed to set the system in the same language used for the launching of Performance forms. 

In addition, if a manager has, for example, two direct reports that have the forms launched in different laguages, the tool Stack Ranker is empty is all languages.

Is this the expected bahavior? 

Thanks for advise.

entry.title: Is "Configuring Device Verification Settings" available for MDK applications?
entry.content:
The documentation of new features April 2025 for Mobile Services lists a security feature described as:

"

Admins can create and bind security tokens specifically for applications. This enhances authentication by providing a second-factor verification step on devices managed by Intune.

For more information, see Configuring Device Verification Settings.

"

Is this available for MDK applications?

I enabled this for an MDK application, provided random values for "MDK Key" and "MDK Value". But, the Mobile Service Client I downloaded from App Store (IOS) was able to access the application. I thought this would prevent access by clients from public App store to access an application which has enabled this setting.

entry.title: Re: SOAP API for inbound delivery updates
entry.content:
Hello @kdv3 

Creating batch-split items for an existing inbound delivery in S/4HANA Public cloud is done via the OData A2X API API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV_0002 using the CreateBatchSplitItem action on the delivery item.
The SOAP you found (WAREHOUSESTOCKTRANSFERRECEIPTA) is a 3PL receipt-advice interface; it won’t update deliveries or create batch splits.

POST /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV_0002

  /A_InbDeliveryItem(DeliveryDocument='{DLV}',DeliveryDocumentItem='{ITEM}')

  /CreateBatchSplitItem

Notes

  • The item should be batch-managed but still kept flexible for changes GR not posted.
  • Verify the HTTP status for success before reading back the item to observe the new split lines.

Helpful SAP references

The resource list for the Inbound Delivery A2X API now features CreateBatchSplitItem for the item: SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Help – Create Batch Split Item: what It does or is required. Let me know if you'd like any more help or clarification fields: SAP Help Portal

SOAP Warehouse Stock Transfer Receipt Advice – this is a receipt advice, not a delivery update API. SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Secure 2.0 Section 603 High Earners Roth Catch-up only not deducting Roth
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have set up config according to Note 3365473.  BN603 in T5F99K2 is set to WRNG_CALC.  

We have automatic rollover to catch-up after annual limit of 23,500 is reached. 

For the High Earner employee, the pre-tax catchup is stopped and placed in wagetype /TB8. 

But, the Roth catchup amount is also placed in /TB8 WT?   

We want the Roth catchup to be calculated and placed in Roth catchup Wagetypes.  

What is the fix?  Please let us know.  We are not able to move forward.  

Regards

Paddy

entry.title: Re: Why work order is not getting triggered from Ik11 for...
entry.content: Hi , when you start the PM plan for first time always use a start date so that the next planned counter reading is always greater than the current reading ( eg if cycle is 250 and last maint was performed in 1000 hours and current reading is 1100 then we start the plan to forecast for 1350 hours but if no maintenance was performed and you expect more past due calls from start counter reading of 0 then the dates might be wrong)  , The starting of the plan should not be very outdated with lot of past due and SAP recommends that . SO ensure that you provide a  realistic dates

3. Imported the budget using Import financial plan data, selected Cost centre budgeting template

please tell me what are the things, that could went wrong.

entry.title: SAP BTP Developer’s Guide: Essential Best Practices from Setup to Scale
entry.content:
The SAP BTP Guidance Framework is your compass towards architecting, developing, and operating solutions on SAP BTP. It is the central access point for decision guides, reference architectures, methodologies, recommendations and DevOps principles. IT guides developers, administrators, architects, and partners with best practices along their journey.

This blog post focuses on the SAP BTP Developer’s Guide, which is a guided path for application development on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP). As part of our blog series, we are diving into several topic areas to best help you navigate the framework. Refer to our first blog post for an introduction to the BTP Guidance Framework.

Who is the SAP BTP Developer’s Guide for?

The SAP BTP Developer’s Guide is embedded into the SAP BTP Guidance Framework and is dedicated to developers, architects, development project leads, and SAP partners. The guide supports each role to plan the application architecture, define the correct methodologies and tools, and select the right services. SAP partners can additionally use the guide to set up SAP BTP for developing and running applications and services for their customers.

What is it about?

The SAP BTP Developer’s Guide explains the building blocks for developing, delivering, and running business applications following the design-led development phases. As development projects for business applications have similar characteristics, this guide condenses best practices and technologies that can be safely recommended to you. The goal of the guide is to support you along the development process as a standardized development guidance and to drive developer efficiency.

 

 

ExploreIdentify the business opportunity and set up the roles and responsibilities in your team.
DiscoverIdentify required use cases and understand the end user holistically. Get familiar with the available technology and get to know use case patterns that can be implemented using SAP BTP. Explore the set of tools and services that allow you to keep the pace when developing applications and at the same time benefit from future innovations in SAP BTP.
Design

Design the user experience of your application to provide good usability. Use domain-driven design to create an application that is modularized and has shorter innovation cycles and a clearer focus. Before you begin developing your applications, make sure your landscape setup is appropriate for managing their lifecycles.

DeliverDevelop your application by following the recommendations for the respective programming model (CAP & ABAP Cloud), programming languages, development tools and consider aspects such as multitenancy, security, extensibility and others.
Run & Scale Get constant feedback from your users, optimize the application based on their feedback, and operate the application using the services and capabilities SAP BTP offers.

What’s next? - Continuous Development

The SAP BTP Developer’s Guide is a living document, and we are constantly updating and reassessing it. To get an overview about all the changes, we provide a dedicated page to show you what’s new for the BTP Developer's Guide in a comprehensive way.

The guide relies on your feedback which you can actively provide using GitHub. Prerequisite is that you are using the English version of the guide. Giving us feedback will get you in contact with the responsible authors of the SAP Help Portal pages and the development team to discuss documentation-related issues. To contribute to the BTP Developer’s Guide or to provide your feedback you have two options:

  • Click on Feedback > Create Issue: Provide feedback about a documentation page. This option opens an issue on GitHub.
  • Click on Feedback > Edit on GitHub: Contribute to a documentation page. This option opens a pull request on GitHub.

 

You can even comment directly in the guide when you have an SAP user and sign in.

To collaborate with us you can find more information here:

  • Contribution Guidelines
  • Introduction Video
  • Introduction Blog Post

With this we wish you successful application development.

For more resources explore the guidance framework or refer to the previous blog post: SAP BTP Guidance Framework Introduction. You can also stay tuned for the next blog post of the series covering Extensibility (will be linked as soon as possible).

Your SAP BTP Developer’s Guide Team

entry.title: Multiple commodity code for a product - S4 Public cloud
entry.content:
Hello all

I have one question concerning commoditiy code in S4 hana public cloud. 

Is there a possibility to assign different commodity codes to a same product according to the country (or customer) where it is shipped ?

Middle east countries custom require 12 digit commodity code. Today we are working with 8 digit commodity code. In order to avoid any change in the custom process with our current customers/countries, we would like to know if it's possible to assign to products a commodity code with 12 digit that would apply only for some destination countries (middel east).

In the app [Manage commodity codes] I see a field 'No Scheme Content'  Would it be possible to have a scheme that applies for middle east country and another scheme that apply for other countries ? If yes how can I proceed ? 

The commodity code is just printed on our invoices

Thanks for your advice !

entry.title: Re: India HSN Code for Services missing in the Service file
entry.content:
In the Services area the field corresponding to HSN Code for India in the Material data is labelled as Accounting Code of the Service.
It is not possible for SAP to change the labelling of the field at the present time.

entry.title: Is your SAP SuccessFactors Data undermining your AI strategy? By 3n Strategy
entry.content:
Register here

SAP customers are excited about the power of AI and GenAI – but excitement alone isn’t enough. For AI to generate real HR value, SuccessFactors customers must first ensure their data is clean, complete, and strategically managed. Without this foundation, AI outputs will be limited, misleading, or even damaging.

This session is designed for People Analytics leaders and HR Tech stakeholders who want to maximise their SAP investment. You’ll explore what it really takes to prepare your data for AI, what tools like SAP Business Data Cloud offer SuccessFactors users, and how to define a roadmap that turns hype into impact.

What You Will Learn:
  • Why clean and complete SuccessFactors data is essential before benefitting from upcoming SAP AI and GenAI features
  • How tools like SAP Business Data Cloud fit into your data strategy
  • Practical steps to align your HR data, technology, and people to enable successful AI adoption

Who is 3n Strategy?

We enable SuccessFactors customers to Make Better People Decisions by using HR data to answer HR questions. We are SAP SuccessFactors partners that specialise in People Analytics, Reporting and Strategic Workforce Planning.

entry.title: Re: Algorithm 015 only checks 13 chars (CHECT). How to cl...
entry.content:
May be you can check SAP Note 2032814 which introduces a custom interpretation algorithm (901) that can be tailored to handle longer references, provides coding logic to extend matching beyond 13 characters. Recommended for S/4HANA systems where standard algorithms fall short.
Further, you can also check SAP Note 2015842 which adds support for the KIDNO field in BSEG and related tables. Enables matching based on longer reference numbers (e.g., UTRs). Often used in conjunction with Note 2032814. These two notes are more aligned with S/4HANA architecture and offer a clean-core compliant way to extend EBS matching logic.

entry.title: Re: How correct data on completed I-9 Form and E-Verify i...
entry.content:
Hi Julie, We went live with 2.0 last October. I9s have been a pain point for us. 

To my knowledge, there isn’t a way to update existing documents once submitted. The I-9 can only be corrected if the corporate representative has not yet signed or submitted it to E-Verify. In that case, you can use Take Action > Correct Section 1 or 2 to make the necessary updates in onboarding.

If you hear of a different approach, please do share. Currently, our process involves completing a paper form and attaching it to Manage Documents, followed by submitting a new E-Verify to reflect the correction.

We’ve also followed the guidance outlined in the link below for a few cases: https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-onboarding/implementing-onboarding/creating-task-to-correct-uscis-form-i-9 

Ultimately, whether the I-9 can be corrected depends on where the new hire or rehire is in the onboarding process.

entry.title: Uncover HR Priorities & Build your road to Agentic AI (EMEA)
entry.content:
In today's rapidly evolving HR landscape, Agentic AI is set to increase HR influence on workforce productivity and strategic alignment, becoming a key driver for organizational growth and business outcomes. This requires establishing a robust business case for AI in HR and ensure alignment between organization, economics, people, and technology. This session is designed to help HR leaders uncover critical HR priorities within their organization and get them started on the road to an agentic AI operating model through the building of a meaningful a business case. 

Register now

In this webinar we will showcase how FLASH powered by SAP can help you to:

  • Discover company strengths and prioritize business opportunities

  • Visualize business maturity against industry benchmarks with personalized reporting

  • Gain insights from industry expertise, best practices, and thought leadership to drive optimal business value 

This session will include time for Q&A

entry.title: Re: Multiple commodity code for a product - S4 Public cloud
entry.content:
Yes it is possible to assign different commodity codes to the same product based on destination country by using numbering schemes and scheme content.

SAP allows you to define multiple numbering schemes (e.g., EU01 for EU countries, ME01 for Middle East) and assign scheme content that reflects the structure and length of the commodity code required by each region.

For example:

  • EU01 → 8-digit CN code
  • ME01 → 12-digit Middle East code

Using the Classify Products – Commodity Codes app (App ID F2151), you can:

  • Select the numbering scheme relevant to the destination country
  • Assign the appropriate commodity code to the product
  • Maintain valid-from/to dates to control applicability

This allows the same product to have multiple commodity code classifications; each tied to a specific scheme and destination country.

Key considerations are

For more details, you can explore SAP’s guide on classifying products for trade statistics

entry.title: Requirement for Maintaining and Posting Landed Cost During Goods Receipt for Partial Purchase Order
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

The client requires a solution for scenarios where the landed cost (freight and customs charges) is not known at the time of creating the purchase order. When receiving lots and posting Goods Receipt (GRN), the actual landed cost becomes available, which may also apply to partial quantities of the purchase order. The client would like to maintain the landed cost during GRN, ensuring that it is posted to the received lot’s material.

Please advise on how this process can be mapped in the system on priority.

Regards

Basil

entry.title: Re: Quick Tips and Tricks - SF Compensation/Variable Pay
entry.content:
Hi @S0026396369 

There are two things wrong in your message:

  • You shouldn't be using Rollup just because you want to add everybody into one worksheet, by doing so you repurpose the feature for something it is not intended to do and you increase latency changes in Executive Review for the customer. Please see my comment and suggested leading practice in this blog : https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/understanding-the-rollup-hierarchy-method-of-planning/ba-p/13563323
  • Yes inactive employees can be added to Variable Pay (and compensation) worksheets, as long as they still have an active supervisor in the system. Not sure where you find that information that it isn't supported. More than half of our customers need to pay bonuses for terminated employees, for example people who retired in the last part of the fiscal year of reference are usually eligible for a prorated bonus. See this blog for design leading practices to handle cases like this. https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/managing-terminated-and-leave-of-absence-employees-in-variable-pay/ba-p/13446019

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Integration Center Version Limitation
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We’re currently using SuccessFactors Integration Center and have run into the limitation where only 50 versions of an integration can be maintained. Since Integration Center requires the creation of a new version each time an integration is edited and saved, we’re finding that we hit this limit quite quickly—especially for frequently updated integrations.

Has anyone found a creative or efficient way to manage this limitation? Do any companies have internal processes or tools to help with version control, archiving, or cleanup? Any tips or best practices would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your insights.

entry.title: Re: Requirement for Maintaining and Posting Landed Cost D...
entry.content:
Couple of options are there to take care of this requirement.

Option 1: Subsequent Debit via MIRO
After GR is posted, use MIRO to post a subsequent debit for freight/customs. This allows you to add costs after GR, and if configured correctly, the cost can be capitalized to inventory. But here the limitation is, in S/4HANA Public Cloud, MIRO is limited and may not support full flexibility for unplanned costs unless the PO has a delivery cost condition.

Option 2: Use Service PO for Freight Vendor
Create a separate service PO for the freight/customs vendor. Post Service Entry Sheet (SES) only for deliveries that incurred actual costs. Use account assignment category 'U' (unknown) or link to the same cost object as the material PO. This gives you control over which deliveries incurred cost and allows you to post the cost at the time of GR.

Option 3: Use Landed Cost App (If Available)
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, SAP provides a Landed Cost Management app (scope item 1YB) that allows capturing landed costs after GR, allocating costs to specific GRs. Posting to inventory valuation. This is the most elegant solution if the scope item is activated in your tenant.

Configuration Tips

  • Ensure delivery cost condition types are set up in MM pricing procedure (e.g., ZFR1 for inventory, ZFR2 for expense).
  • Use accrual keys and assign to correct G/L accounts via OBYC.
  • For partial GRs, ensure GR-based invoice verification is active so costs can be matched per delivery.
